hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Regime Transition via Term Structure Inversion
hypothesis_content.statement: When 1-month implied volatility exceeds 3-month implied volatility by >5 volatility points during NEUTRAL regime, and spot price is within 3% of yearly high, the subsequent volatility expansion (>10 vol points increase in 1-month IV) signals transition to STRESS regime within 5 trading days with 70% accuracy.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility term structure inversion near highs indicates options market anticipating breakdown. Regulatory event risk (MiCA enforcement dates) causes dealers to hedge short gamma positions, accelerating volatility feedback loop.

exit_conditions.take_profit: Volatility term structure normalizes (3m IV > 1m IV) OR 25% profit on long volatility position
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1-month IV drops below entry level despite price movement
exit_conditions.time_exit: 7 days after entry if no regime change

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: IV expansion occurs without spot movement >5%. Term structure normalizes within 2 days without regime change.
